commands.name: ls
commands.what: Lists files and directories in the current location
commands.why: Essential for navigating and understanding your file system structure
commands.when: Use whenever you need to see what files or folders exist in a directory

examples.desc: List all files with details including hidden files

commands.output:
total 24
drwxr-xr-x  5 user  staff   160 Dec 15 10:30 .
-rw-r--r--  1 user  staff  1024 Dec 15 10:30 app.js
drwxr-xr-x  3 user  staff    96 Dec 15 10:25 src
mistakes: Forgetting -a flag to see hidden files
Not using -h for readable file sizes
Confusing ls with cd command
commands.realWorld: DevOps engineers use 'ls -la' daily to check deployment directories, verify file permissions, and troubleshoot missing configuration files on servers.
commands.practice: List all files in /var/log directory with detailed information

commands.name: cd
commands.why: Navigate through different folders in your system
commands.when: Use when you need to move to a different directory to work with files there
mistakes: Forgetting spaces in directory names need quotes
Using backslashes instead of forward slashes
Not using 'cd ~' shortcut for home directory
commands.realWorld: Navigate to application directories like /opt/app or /var/www/html to deploy code, check logs, or modify configurations.
commands.practice: Navigate to your home directory and then to the Documents folder

commands.name: chmod
commands.what: Changes file permissions and access rights
commands.why: Control who can read, write, or execute files - critical for security
commands.when: Setting up applications, fixing permission issues, securing sensitive files

examples.desc: Make script executable by owner, readable by others

commands.output:
$ chmod 755 deploy.sh
$ ls -l deploy.sh
-rwxr-xr-x 1 user staff 2048 Dec 15 10:30 deploy.sh
mistakes: Using 777 (all permissions) for everything - security risk!
Forgetting -R flag for directories
Not understanding numeric permissions (755, 644, etc.)
commands.realWorld: Set execute permissions on CI/CD scripts, secure SSH keys with 600, and ensure web files have correct permissions.
commands.practice: Make a shell script executable and verify the permissions changed

commands.name: grep
commands.what: Searches for patterns in files or input
commands.why: Find specific text, errors, or patterns in logs and files
commands.when: Debugging, log analysis, searching configuration files

examples.desc: Case-insensitive search in all log files

commands.output:
app.log:45:ERROR: Connection timeout
app.log:67:ERROR: Database unavailable
app.log:123:ERROR: Authentication failed
mistakes: Forgetting quotes around patterns with spaces
Not using -i for case-insensitive search
Not using -r for recursive directory search
commands.realWorld: Search production logs for errors, find configuration values, audit code for security issues.
commands.practice: Search for all ERROR messages in /var/log/syslog

commands.name: cat
commands.what: Displays file contents or concatenates files
commands.why: Quickly view file contents without opening an editor
commands.when: Viewing configuration files, logs, or combining files
mistakes: Using cat for very large files (use less instead)
Forgetting cat can concatenate multiple files
Not using -n for debugging line-specific issues
commands.realWorld: View configuration files, check environment variables, combine log files for analysis.
commands.practice: Display the contents of /etc/hosts with line numbers

commands.name: mkdir
commands.why: Organize files and create project structures
commands.when: Setting up new projects, creating log directories, organizing files
mistakes: Forgetting -p flag for nested directories
Not checking if directory already exists
Creating directories with spaces without quotes
commands.realWorld: Create deployment directories, set up project structures, organize backup locations.
commands.practice: Create a project structure with src, test, and docs directories

commands.name: cp
commands.why: Duplicate files, create backups, move content
commands.when: Making backups, duplicating configurations, deploying files
mistakes: Forgetting -r flag for directories
Overwriting files without backup
Not preserving permissions with -p
commands.realWorld: Create configuration backups before changes, copy deployment artifacts, duplicate log files for analysis.
commands.practice: Create a backup of a configuration file before editing

commands.name: mv
commands.what: Moves or renames files and directories
commands.why: Reorganize files, rename items, move content between locations
commands.when: Renaming files, moving logs, organizing deployments
mistakes: Accidentally overwriting existing files
Not using -i for interactive confirmation
Moving instead of copying important files
commands.realWorld: Archive old logs, rename configuration files during deployments, organize backup files.
commands.practice: Rename a file and move it to a different directory

commands.name: rm
commands.why: Clean up temporary files, remove old logs, delete unwanted content
commands.when: Cleaning up after builds, removing old deployments, freeing disk space
mistakes: Using rm -rf without double-checking path
Forgetting -r flag for directories
Not using -i for important deletions
commands.realWorld: Clean build artifacts, remove old log files, delete temporary deployment files.
commands.practice: Remove all .tmp files from current directory safely

commands.name: find
commands.what: Searches for files in a directory hierarchy
commands.why: Locate files by name, type, size, or modification time
commands.when: Finding configuration files, locating large files, searching for specific patterns

examples.desc: Find files modified in last 24 hours

mistakes: Forgetting the starting path
Not quoting patterns with wildcards
Confusing -name (case-sensitive) with -iname
commands.realWorld: Find large log files consuming disk space, locate configuration files, search for specific file types.
commands.practice: Find all JavaScript files modified in the last week

commands.name: ps
commands.why: Monitor running applications, troubleshoot system issues
commands.when: Debugging, checking if services are running, monitoring resources
commands.output:
USER  PID %CPU %MEM    VSZ   RSS TTY  STAT START   TIME COMMAND
root    1  0.0  0.1 168936 11400 ?    Ss   Dec14   0:03 node app.js
root  234  0.0  0.2 256789 20480 ?    Sl   Dec14   0:15 nginx
mistakes: Forgetting to use grep to filter results
Not understanding aux vs ef options
Overlooking zombie or defunct processes
commands.realWorld: Check if application servers are running, find memory-hungry processes, debug startup issues.
commands.practice: Find all running Node.js or Python processes

commands.name: kill
commands.what: Sends signals to processes to terminate or control them
commands.why: Stop hung processes, restart services, manage applications
commands.when: Application not responding, need to restart service, freeing resources
commands.output:
$ kill -9 5678
$ ps aux | grep 5678
(no output - process terminated)
mistakes: Using kill -9 as first option (doesn't allow cleanup)
Killing wrong process (verify PID first)
Not checking if process actually stopped
commands.realWorld: Restart hung application servers, terminate runaway processes, reload configuration without restart.
commands.practice: Find and gracefully terminate a process by name

commands.name: tail
commands.what: Displays the last part of files
commands.why: View recent log entries, monitor files in real-time
commands.when: Debugging, monitoring logs, checking recent activity
mistakes: Not using -f for real-time monitoring
Forgetting to specify number of lines
Using cat instead of tail for large files
commands.realWorld: Monitor application logs during deployments, debug production issues in real-time, watch for errors.
commands.practice: Monitor the system logs in real-time

commands.name: ssh
commands.why: Access and manage remote systems securely
commands.when: Deploying to servers, debugging remote issues, managing infrastructure
commands.output:
$ ssh deploy@production-server
Welcome to Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS
Last login: Sun Dec 15 09:00:00 2024
deploy@production-server:~$
mistakes: Wrong permissions on SSH key (should be 600)
Connecting to wrong port
Not adding server to known_hosts
commands.realWorld: Deploy applications to production servers, troubleshoot remote systems, manage cloud infrastructure.
commands.practice: Connect to a remote server and check its uptime

commands.name: curl
commands.what: Transfers data from or to a server
commands.why: Test APIs, download files, debug network issues
commands.when: Testing endpoints, downloading scripts, checking connectivity
mistakes: Forgetting Content-Type header for POST requests
Not using -v for debugging
Ignoring SSL certificate errors in production
commands.realWorld: Test API endpoints, health checks in CI/CD, download installation scripts.
commands.practice: Test the health endpoint of a running service

quiz.question: You need to list all files including hidden configuration files. Which command?
quiz.explanation: ls -la combines -l (detailed list) with -a (all files including hidden). Most comprehensive listing.

quiz.question: What does 'chmod 755 script.sh' do?
options: Owner can read/write/execute, others can read/execute
quiz.explanation: 755 means: Owner (7=rwx), Group (5=rx), Others (5=rx). Standard for executable scripts.
